column4:
I just spoke on the Senate Floor about #WhatsAtStake if Judge Barrett is confirmed to SCOTUS. 
 
Americans desperately need COVID-19 relief. 
 
Meanwhile, Senate Republicans insist on taking up valuable time ramming through this sham nomination. 
https://t.co/U6XaBGwrqx

This pandemic has shown us that we have failed to prioritize working mothers’ needs. 
 
It’s time for the Senate to pass real solutions for women and families, like equal pay, paid family leave, extending SNAP benefits, and investing in our child care infrastructure. #momsbailout

RT @SenateDems: 72% of Americans support a major investment in supporting American families struggling through the COVID crisis.

But Repub…

Judge Barrett has repeatedly and publicly criticized the Affordable Care Act and said that the Supreme Court should invalidate it. 
 
Rushing through this nomination will put millions of Americans' health care at risk. #BlockBarrett #WeDissent https://t.co/El09wISVwE

We’re facing the greatest public health and economic crises in our lifetimes. Meeting the full scale of these challenges requires big thinking and big solutions. This moment demands that we invest in innovation.

Read more in my @thenewmexican op-ed here: https://t.co/MfcnBHcciQ

We can do better, New Mexico. And if we want to protect our economy, we need to do better.
 
Mask up. Avoid groups. Let’s keep each other safe. https://t.co/iblzB9vqi7

Overturning the Affordable Care Act would mean discrimination, higher costs, and even outright denial of coverage for the more than 800,000 New Mexicans living with pre-existing conditions like heart disease, diabetes, cancer, and, yes, COVID-19. #WhatsAtStake

Hiding from the facts is not excusable. 

Amy Coney Barrett's refusal to take a "firm view" on the climate crisis is a major threat to our planet, our economy, our health, and the future of humanity.

President Trump said that it was “important” to get “his” SCOTUS nominee confirmed prior to the election. Now “his” nominee won’t agree to recuse herself in cases involving Trump. This jeopardizes the very foundation of the SCOTUS as an equal and independent branch of government.

I see no justification for denying adequate time for a full and accurate count of communities across NM. 

The Trump admin’s efforts to thwart the success of the 2020 Census during a public health crisis will have severe implications on the lives of every New Mexican for years. https://t.co/UIwbsEDWqC

Ten years after the ACA was passed, Republicans have finally found their Death Panel. 

A vote to confirm Amy Coney Barrett is a vote to eliminate health care for millions with cancer, diabetes, or a heart condition. 

People will die. #WhatsAtStake

We’ve flattened the curve before, and it’s time to do it again.
 
With COVID cases going up, it’s critical you mask up. Keep your distance. Limit interactions and avoid mass gatherings.

The pandemic has taken a toll on many Americans' mental health. 

The ACA improves access to screenings & treatment for mental illnesses like depression. If Republicans succeed at repealing it, millions will lose these services at a time when they need them most. #WhatsAtStake

There are only 33 days until SCOTUS hears the case attempting to strike down the ACA. 
 
It's unconscionable that during a massive public health crisis, this administration is still dead-set on taking away millions of Americans' access to health care. #WhatsAtStake

The children and families seeking asylum have a legal right to be here and receive due process. While volunteers have provided many with shelter in Mexico, they’re overwhelmed. 

This administration is using the pandemic to push their inhumane and heartless immigration policies.

The reports that @VP ordered @CDCgov to close America's borders—despite no evidence to show that this would slow the spread of COVID-19—are sickening.

@OIGatHHS must investigate this blatant political interference with our nation's public health response. https://t.co/P6QiQ4ahOH

Getting out in New Mexico's public lands has never been easier. You can now purchase day passes to state parks online at https://t.co/5ZJiGK5IUz, which helps reduce person-to-person contact with park staff.

Remember to follow all public health guidelines when visiting our parks! https://t.co/UzQJpKiOyF

By focusing on a SCOTUS nominee instead of much-needed COVID-19 relief, President Trump and Majority Leader McConnell are showing their true colors: the American people are not their priority. https://t.co/9rhPdp9dop

Helping Americans survive a pandemic can wait until after the election, but a lifetime appointment to the Supreme Court can't? 

Wow. https://t.co/1FintK2EFW

If SCOTUS rules against the ACA, around 20 million Americans will lose health coverage. Protections for preexisting conditions—which include COVID-19—will disappear.
 
This is all while we are struggling with a massive public health crisis. #WhatsAtStake https://t.co/hmJ3VgaLhW

TOMORROW: @NMDOH is holding free COVID-19 testing in Las Cruces on Saturday, October 3rd, from 8 to 10 AM at the Las Cruces Public Health Office (1170 N Solano Drive). If you plan to be tested, you must register at https://t.co/dHYDs6HGGC. All testing is free of charge.

Nursing homes are particularly vulnerable to the spread of COVID-19. With this critical federal funding, I am glad to see UNM's @ProjectECHO work to improve infection control strategies for more than 15,000 nursing homes across the country. https://t.co/X7inMU1gAZ
In the middle of a pandemic, we should be working to expand health care—not destroying the Affordable Care Act. #SaveOurHealthCare

The Affordable Care Act lawsuit goes before the Supreme Court in November. If the #ACA is repealed, 23 million Americans will lose coverage. 

@senatemajldr is fighting tooth and nail to make this happen by rushing through a Supreme Court nomination. #SaveOurHealthCare

If Amy Coney Barrett's nomination is pushed through before the election, it will have major implications for the upcoming Affordable Care Act case going before SCOTUS. 
 
If this plays out how we think it will, thousands and thousands of New Mexicans could lose their health care.

The House passed the HEROES Act in May. Nearly 5 months ago.
 
It's almost October and @senatemajldr is hellbent on fast-tracking a SCOTUS nomination instead of helping the American people.
 
Majority Leader, it's way past time to bring a COVID-19 relief bill to the Senate floor.

The Every Kid Outdoors program allows 4th graders to access our public lands for free. But because of COVID-19, many students were not able to fully utilize their passes this year. @SenAlexander and I are calling on @Interior to extend their passes for the 2020-2021 school year. https://t.co/KVPSBwj3Z0

TOMORROW: @NMDOH is holding free COVID-19 testing in Deming on Saturday, September 26th, from 8 to 10 AM at the Luna County Public Health Office (215 South Silver Ave). 

If you plan to get tested, you must register at https://t.co/LoSftRWN86. All testing is free of charge.

While @senatemajldr is trying to move heaven and earth to fill Justice Ginsburg's seat, the American people are still suffering from the effects of this pandemic. People are dying. Businesses are hurting. 
 
This is a disgrace. The Senate must pass COVID-19 relief now.

SUNDAY: @NMDOH is providing free COVID-19 testing in Roswell on Sunday, September 20th at the Roswell Public Health Office (200 E Chisum) from 8:30 AM to 11:30 AM. To be tested, you must register ahead of time at https://t.co/LoSftRWN86. All testing is completely free of charge.

We must also stand up against President Trump's attacks on immigrants and communities of color and acknowledge the heavy toll that the pandemic has taken on so many Hispanic families. I’ll continue to fight for issues that matter to NM's diverse Hispanic and Latino communities.
In the midst of this pandemic, our open spaces and our ability to seek exercise, recreation and respite, are more important than ever. https://t.co/2mUQIqgQgN

Many rural tribal communities in NM do not have access to broadband internet.
 
My bipartisan, bicameral Tribal Connect Act will work to strengthen broadband access and help connect these communities to education, health, and career-related resources. https://t.co/FbIzZTpO2p

Now more than ever, it is critical for all of us to get the flu shot. Please do it as soon as you can to protect your health, your family, and your community during flu season. https://t.co/J0gt9RBKKJ
Ignoring a problem doesn't make it go away. In fact, willfully ignoring science and denying tests to Americans will only make this deadly pandemic worse.  https://t.co/xUxxM28mfk

Mail delays during normal times are a major problem.
 
Mail delays during a pandemic in the middle of an election are a catastrophe. 
 
An attack on @USPS not only harms Americans who depend on its essential services—it is also a threat to our democracy. #DontMessWithUSPS

President Trump's payroll tax scheme not only won't solve our public health and economic crises, but it's also a direct attack on Social Security.
 
President Trump is defunding your retirement. https://t.co/CHqlI6c4Lh

The National Guard has been critical to the public health response in NM and across the nation. There is no rational justification for the president to arbitrarily pick and choose which states receive full funding for the National Guard's deployment. https://t.co/WZLF0YsQk8

15,000 Navajo households lack access to electricity. COVID-19 has revealed just how badly these disparities impact the Navajo Nation.
 
My bill with @SenMcSallyAZ will reauthorize the Navajo Electrification Demonstration Program & help @NTUAutilities bring power to Navajo homes. https://t.co/EzwvNp7QNi

Yesterday I spoke with @KRWG about how Congress must pass more COVID-19 relief measures, from rebuilding our economy to protecting the U.S. Postal Service and the integrity of the upcoming election.
 
Listen to my interview here ⬇️ https://t.co/8Yt5t1JO68
The United States has recorded over 5 million cases of the coronavirus. Millions of Americans remain out-of-work and without the help they need to put food on the table.

While this year's Santa Fe Indian Market was unable to happen as usual due to the pandemic, you can still see incredible works and shop directly from hundreds of Native American artists in this year's Virtual Market. It will be online for all of August. https://t.co/oOW5Uv5fnP
Be smart and stay safe ABQ. The right to protest and peacefully assemble is critical to a healthy Democracy.

I will keep doing everything in my power to fight for the support New Mexicans need, the science-based public health response necessary to save lives, and economic investments to rebuild our communities.
Thousands of families in New Mexico are on edge today. The unemployment benefits that have been a critical lifeline for so many during this pandemic are set to run out.

We need a relief package that helps New Mexicans make ends meet through the pandemic, and looks toward our long-term recovery. 

That absolutely includes unemployment insurance. 

Congress must #ExtendUI and alleviate the tremendous uncertainty that many families face.
I’m proud to be involved with a dedicated group of organizations that are committed to securing the equipment that is necessary for an effective public health response.

The NM COVID-19 Emergency Supply Collaborative (@CovidNm) has been doing tremendous work making sure New Mexico’s health care providers have the PPE they need to do their heroic work safely. https://t.co/8qJZbZgtc6
Improving the air quality over the Four Corners will also have profound positive long-term health consequences for thousands of New Mexicans living in the region and downwind.

It is deeply disappointing to see Facebook ignoring disinformation about climate change while it aims to help its users fact check posts on other important scientific topics like COVID-19. 

I am calling on Facebook to end this policy immediately. https://t.co/PjqBGu3iHz

Outrageous. Local governments are already pressed for funds responding to the pandemic, let alone to implement more mail-in and early voting measures this fall. We have an obligation to make sure the upcoming election is safe and secure for all Americans. https://t.co/2v2effN6KQ
Up is down in the Trump Administration. The reality is that there has been no testing leadership from this White House and it shows. https://t.co/cfBzXHrbT6
RT @JECDems: REPORT: The lack of universal #PaidSickLeave in the U.S. is creating a perverse incentive for millions of workers to go to wor…

We need #PaidSickLeave so America's workers aren't put in the impossible position of choosing between their health and a paycheck.

@JECDems just released a report that helps explain why universal paid sick leave is so critical: https://t.co/VSmlRxGlAe

The Senate recently passed the Great American Outdoors Act, which will fully and permanently fund LWCF. Now that the House is bringing GAOA to a vote this week, it's time to reel it in. 

A special thanks to @EnvAm for my #FundLWCF mask! #MaskUp https://t.co/qLC82Q3682

We need to recognize that this public health and economic crisis is not ending in the next couple weeks and start planning for the long-term support New Mexicans need to stay healthy and return to work safely. https://t.co/hRvNVNaB2s

We're in the bad place we're in because we haven't scaled up a national plan on testing. And the White House wants to cut funding for testing, contact tracing, and the CDC? Are you kidding me? https://t.co/9qyRm9bfx7

International students should not be barred or expelled from the U.S. simply for being enrolled at an institution of higher learning that chooses to follow guidance issued by trusted public health officials. 
https://t.co/buBvxe2NDn

As COVID-19 has left thousands of New Mexicans looking for new employment, I remain committed to rebuilding strong economies in every part of our state. 
 
I’ve partnered with @USOPM, @NMDWS, and @UNM to launch a Virtual Job Fair hosted on my website: https://t.co/SctO6eIlJj. https://t.co/Zhhracp3H3

President Trump exploits CDC guidelines to deport unaccompanied minors and then dismisses that guidance on schools so he can rush to reopen businesses. The only consistency is that Trump is putting kids in danger for his own selfish gain. https://t.co/qNXcoUVzui

The permanent trauma President Trump is inflicting on innocent children is appalling and does not represent who we are as a nation. As we continue to deal with the impacts and spread of COVID-19, we need to ensure the health and safety of these children.

I find it disgusting that the president is using a global pandemic as cover to implement its inhumane, anti-immigrant policies and turn away migrant children at our nation’s southern border—many of whom are fleeing extreme violence and terror in their home countries. https://t.co/O74Q4gjK5H

COVID numbers are surging, workers are getting laid off AGAIN, and what do POTUS and Mitch McConnell want to do about it?

Nothing.

McConnell is even shutting down efforts to deal directly with the pandemic or the economic aftermath on the Senate floor this week. https://t.co/TCDSYuc0hc

During this public health crisis, I want to make sure you and your family have health coverage that fits your needs. With the NM Coverage Connector, you can find out if you're eligible for free or low-cost health coverage. #NMEnrollmentDay #StayCoveredNM https://t.co/nwPodkrnVP https://t.co/U4YZarJSSE

The Supreme Court's ruling affirms that women have the right to choose what is best for their body and well-being.
 
We must continue to protect Roe v. Wade and ensure that ideological views never interfere with personal health care decisions. https://t.co/FJ1e02fz4m

I will keep fighting to put these dollars back in the pockets of hard-working New Mexicans and minimize financial uncertainties during what has become the greatest public health crisis of our generation.

New Mexicans shouldn't have to worry about losing money because of travel plans disrupted by COVID-19. 

I'm proud to cosponsor the Cash Refunds for Coronavirus Cancellations Act, which will require airlines to offer full cash refunds for tickets canceled during the pandemic.

I'll be joining @NMLandOffice and @PoweringNM tomorrow at 4 p.m. MT to discuss New Mexico's clean energy future and how we can include the clean energy workforce in our nation's recovery from the COVID-19 crisis. Tune in tomorrow via Facebook Live! https://t.co/t0Xsrg688w

POTUS on COVID-19: “It’s fading away...”

Reality, in a fact-based world: COVID-19 has now killed more Americans than the 1st World War and is surging in many states.

RT @GovMLG: New Mexico: the pandemic has not let up.

You are still required to wear a mask or face covering in public.

Wearing a mask sig…

New corona cases in New Mexico = 94

New corona cases in Florida = 3823

It’s time for POTUS and Republican governors to stop ignoring COVID-19, or the damage to lives AND the economy will be devastating.

Willful ignorance is not a strategy.

Withholding life-saving COVID-19 data from tribal communities widens the health disparities that are already running rampant in areas ill-equipped to contain the spread and the outcomes of this pandemic. 
 
I expect better from @CDCgov. Read my letter to Director Redfield below. https://t.co/cJcUbkQVCS
The new Trump administration strategy for COVID-19 is to pretend it doesn’t exist. Meanwhile, numbers are surging in many states, threatening lives and the economy.

RT @NWF: "For so many of us, staying safe and healthy – mentally, physically and spiritually — comes back to the great outdoors."

Learn fr…

Like so many actions by this administration, this will rightly be challenged in court. Any New Mexicans experiencing harassment or denial of health coverage as a result of this should continue to report discrimination and seek legal assistance.

This blatant discrimination against transgender Americans will put a particularly vulnerable community at greater health risk in the middle of a pandemic. Once again, President Trump chooses division and hate over helping all Americans. https://t.co/QMsYbajqFu
RT @NMEnvDep: If you work at a restaurant, grocery store, farmer's market or food manufacturing facility, you can get tested for #COVID19 f…
Water is already a scarce resource—especially in New Mexico. The last thing our Tribal communities need as they recover from this pandemic is their water supplies being put at risk.

It is unthinkable that while Tribal communities are being ravaged by COVID-19, this administration is eroding their right to protect the water within their borders from potentially destructive projects like pipelines and dams. https://t.co/ilxvQvQRi0

I joined my colleagues today in the Capitol’s Emancipation Hall for a moment of silence. We gathered in memory of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, and Ahmaud Arbery. And we stood in solidarity with Americans peacefully protesting racial injustice in NM and across the country. https://t.co/7bFWYZC4Nf

We should listen to and embrace those frustrated but non-violent voices sick and tired of the baked in racial injustice in our country. They are not the violent agitators who are taking advantage of a volatile situation and should be held accountable.

Jose and Vannesa Gonzales started Sin Fronteras Nuevo Mexico to provide assistance to immigrant families in Taos County. In light of the pandemic, Sin Fronteras has stepped up its vital work making sure these families are taken care of. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/pTlilTFV1t

The Navajo Nation faces a disproportionate impact due to the pandemic. This administration must be held accountable for the response. I'm calling on @IHSgov to answer for the $3 million contract—given to a former WH official—that resulted in substandard PPE for these communities. https://t.co/QtFOZK1i0f https://t.co/xtPUBWEdI4
RT @businessinsider: The anti-science leadership of Trump, Bolsonaro, and Putin led to the worst coronavirus outbreaks in the world https:/…

ICYMI: New Mexico families who receive SNAP benefits can now use their EBT card to buy groceries online to avoid having to go to the supermarket during the pandemic. If you are in need of food assistance, you can apply for benefits at https://t.co/FgjlygN6Ve. https://t.co/tJvFMajESz

Especially in these times, it’s important to carefully vet the information you are seeing. Please continue to turn to trusted public health and science-based guidance about how to stay safe and healthy.

https://t.co/snzZkuxIJj

Supplies were also delivered to the Gallup Alternative Care Facility and Rehoboth McKinley Christian Hospital. I will keep doing everything in my power to help coordinate these efforts, and to secure the resources New Mexico needs for an effective public health response.

Kim Brown is the President and CEO of @GirlsIncSantaFe, which works to empower and inspire girls and young women in New Mexico. In the face of the pandemic, Kim and her staff had to get creative to continue to achieve their organization's mission. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/6Rd8Yu818E
Bianca and all of the COVID-19 hotline staff, thank you for your commitment to making sure that the public remains informed, as well as helping ease their concerns.

Right now, access to trusted information is critical. Bianca Gonzales, a student pharmacist at the @UNMHSC College of Pharmacy, volunteers with the @NMDOH COVID-19 hotline where she works diligently to provide callers with accurate and up-to-date information. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/yka526havz

RT @OutdoorAlliance: The guide for getting out responsibly during COVID-19:
https://t.co/XAIoMyddco https://t.co/r7XwM7Cgoo

We've been back in session for three weeks and McConnell has refused to address the COVID-19 crisis, even saying we should “press the pause button.”

It would appear he is more interested in packing the courts than he is in packed hospital ICUs, unemployment lines, & food banks.

Tribal communities are being disproportionately impacted by the pandemic. At the same time, the need for internet access in these communities now could not be more apparent. That's why I am calling on the @FCC to ensure rural Tribal communities have equal access to internet. https://t.co/M2eUx9vXAr

Sherry Hooper is the executive director of @TheFoodDepot, a food bank serving northern New Mexico. She is leading the Food Depot's amazing effort to address New Mexico's sharp increase in food insecurity as a result of the #COVID19 pandemic. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/qm4AvVnyw5

Jean has been stepping up to help the Taos area since before the COVID-19 crisis, through her work supporting the ReUse Center in Chamisal as well as organizing community events. Her love and care for her community has left its mark on residents as they navigate this new reality.

.@Protect_NM has been doing great work with their PPE donation drives, and tomorrow they are holding another in partnership with @UNMLOBOS. Head to The Pit (@DreamstyleArena) at UNM from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. to donate masks, gowns, gloves, and hand sanitizer for front line workers. https://t.co/hQXKBUHc0v

After giving away dozens of those masks, Alice started to give masks to anybody who might need one to go to the grocery store, pharmacy, or other public places. Alice, thank you for being a hero and helping Las Cruces residents take steps to keep themselves safe and healthy!

Alice Davenport runs a one-person sewing and alterations shop in Las Cruces. When the COVID-19 pandemic began, Alice knew that she could put her talent to use by making face masks and donating to the city's essential workers.  #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/HzFQMa2PdA

Last night, @SenatorTomUdall and I sat down with @KRQE to discuss the federal response to the coronavirus pandemic, and answer the questions New Mexicans have about the crisis. Watch our interview here: https://t.co/48BhZOcbms

When Erin Garrison's organization was disrupted by COVID-19, she found new ways to serve her community through the non-profit's mission. Food is Free Albuquerque was established to improve the availability of fresh, local produce by helping distribute growers' surplus harvests.

New Mexico has long faced challenges providing adequate behavioral health resources, and this has only been exacerbated by the COVID-19 crisis. 
 
We must #FundMentalHealth because we can't allow this pandemic to create any lapses in behavioral health care for those who need it.

The great work being done through the NM COVID-19 Emergency Supply Collaborative (@CovidNM) makes deliveries like this possible. I'm proud to be partnered with them in the effort to connect our front line workers to the resources they need to continue their lifesaving work.

My staff and I are working around the clock to help facilitate the delivery of critical supplies to health care providers. Yesterday, we joined the Air Force Research Laboratory to deliver 200 face shields to the Zia Pueblo Emergency Operation Center and the Zia Health Clinic. https://t.co/zz04tEmyg0

(2/2) McConnell and Trump are refusing to meet this moment with a serious economic recovery plan and McConnell is doing nothing COVID-related in the Senate this week.

UNBELIEVABLE!!!

There is a disease more devastating than COVID-19 and it’s on the rise. It’s called ignorance.

https://t.co/PY1HL5Pbha

#COVID19 is disproportionately impacting Tribal nations. That's why I've introduced legislation to eliminate the cost-share requirements tied to emergency protective measures, which will allow Tribal governments to access 100% of the funding they need. https://t.co/vh460WSUoY

Peggy McCracken runs the Checkerboard Area Food Pantry, which serves rural areas like Cuba and Gallina, as well as the Navajo communities of Torreon and Ojo Encino. During the #COVID19 crisis, the pantry has provided food to hundreds of families in need.#HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/pHSwLXyKhe
Krista, thank you for hard work keeping Quay County residents safe and healthy. #HometownHeroesNM

Not only does Krista work on the front line of this crisis to care for hospital patients, but she remains on call as Tucumcari Public Schools' lone school nurse, answering questions from faculty, parents, and students.

Our health care professionals have shown grace and compassion as they work around the clock to save New Mexicans' lives. Krista Mericle is a registered nurse in Tucumcari, serving the local hospital's patients as well as working in the emergency department. #NationalNursesDay https://t.co/CeS7jxAa69
RT @SusanMDunlap: Childcare centers need greater federal relief, say advocates #nmpol #COVID__19 https://t.co/STmWnghmwj

They don't stop at simply manufacturing—the COSMIAC team has even been studying the physics of face masks so they can improve upon their design. They now have the capacity to produce thousands of masks, which @NMDHSEM helps distribute.

COSMIAC's director, Craig Kief, his daughter Laura Shaffer, and UNM professor Dr. Christina Salas helped set up a manufacturing operation of 13 3D printers, and their staff of engineering students and volunteer nurses have begun producing face masks and shields.

COSMIAC is a @UNMengineering research center that normally focuses on military and aerospace technology, but as the pandemic hit, they knew they could put their skills and equipment to great use by manufacturing PPE for front line workers. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/WIyKVaNxUl

Tomorrow, the Supreme Court will hear cases challenging a Trump admin rule that exempts employers from providing the #ACA birth control benefit.
 
Women's health decisions shouldn't depend on where they work. Ideological views shouldn't interfere with their choices. #HandsOffMyBC

Hundreds of child care centers across New Mexico have been forced to close or serve just a percentage of the children they normally would. To help stabilize the industry, we must prioritize emergency funding for child care in further #COVID19 legislation. https://t.co/ZWXTJweJyr

Protect NM is partnered with @CovidNm, which was organized to help New Mexico health care providers and medical professionals get the resources they need. If you know of a facility in need, visit https://t.co/JZmhZmxSqE.

.@Protect_NM will be accepting PPE donations at three Albuquerque locations tomorrow, May 2. Drive by between 10 a.m. and 4 p.m. to drop off face masks and shields, gowns, and gloves that will go straight to health professionals on the front line of the crisis. https://t.co/FwklvmBL7x

Through #DemingSHARES, Monica delivers sewing machines and supplies to local volunteers who then help package and deliver face masks to nursing homes, police officers, first responders, and local shelters.

My staff and I have been working around the clock to help get critical supplies like PPE to the health providers who need them. Thank you to @AFResearchLab and the @NSAGov Laboratory for Physical Sciences for helping coordinate a donation of face shields to ABQ’s VA Hospital. https://t.co/RfjyDDHdOA

We can't allow the pandemic to prevent us from preparing for wildfire season. I'm calling on the Forest Service to provide clear plans for how it will ensure the protection of communities, critical infrastructure, and firefighter safety. https://t.co/raf8dlokDz
Because of Melisa’s great effort, thousands of masks have been delivered to New Mexico's front line health workers. Thank you Melisa and everyone at Stitchology!

When it became clear that there would be a shortage of masks, Melisa set up a pick-up location outside her store to distribute kits with enough pre-cut materials to make 25 masks per kit, and a donation box to return finished masks.

Melisa Hart had to close her Albuquerque fabric store, Stitchology, due to #COVID19. But that didn't stop her from using her business and resources to help the community. #HometownHeroesNM https://t.co/hwR17LXcsV

If McConnell calls the Senate into session next week, it should not be to pack the courts with his unqualified nominees.

The Senate should be holding public oversight hearings on shortages of testing supplies and PPE and why small business loans were given to huge corporations.

States have ALREADY stepped up. What we need is a cohesive strategy, increased manufacturing capacity and coordination of the testing supply chain.
 
https://t.co/cledFJLj5x

Tribal nations in New Mexico are facing a disproportionate impact to their populations due to the coronavirus pandemic and access to the $8 billion Coronavirus Relief Fund is vital to their response and recovery efforts.

The first step in any responsible plan to reopen the country must be to scale up a much more comprehensive nationwide testing infrastructure to track, trace, and effectively respond to the spread of the virus. Read more in my op-ed in @thenewmexican: https://t.co/c6eBkeM3Uw

I could not be prouder of New Mexico for demonstrating the right way to take this pandemic seriously and save the lives of our friends and family members. Let's keep it up. 
 
https://t.co/73zPLO4HgK

New Mexico's radio and television broadcasters and newspapers provide local and national news, emergency alerts, educational programs, and more.
 
That's why I'm calling on OMB Acting Director Vought to support these trusted community news outlets during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/S8vyf9MDwD

Dear Mr. President, 

If you want to use your war metaphor, please remember that you are at war with a virus, NOT science and reason.
Now, Linda is using MagEboard to make sure the town gets information from trusted health officials like the CDC and NMDOH, and to provide resources to those who need them. #HometownHeroesNM

To help Magdalena stay connected, Linda Swisher-Smiley began MagEboard, an online newsletter. Even before #COVID19, MagEboard served to keep residents informed not only about community happenings, but also official notices, like school closures & fire warnings. #HometownHeroesNM

A global health crisis means we are all in this together. The racist rhetoric surrounding the coronavirus is not only wrong, but it also stirs hate and fear to divide us during a time when it is critical that we look out for one another. https://t.co/XV0AwEN4Y1

With @SandiaLabs now approved to begin #COVID19 testing, New Mexico can expand its ability to process test results on a daily basis. I thank Sandia and its staff for their tireless work to assist in New Mexico’s coronavirus response efforts.  https://t.co/JEP7tHOkiv

Sandia has converted 100 respirators for New Mexico hospitals for use with COVID-19 patients. This will make a tremendous difference in equipping our health care workers as they save lives and treat New Mexicans during this pandemic. https://t.co/uW6vFc9gKy

RT @SenateDems: We don’t have to sacrifice a healthy economy for a healthy environment.
